DOC.brief_summary: The study evaluate effectiveness culturally relevant , multi-component intervention antenatal depression . The intervention include engagement session , woman 's choice brief interpersonal psychotherapy and/or pharmacotherapy step care treatment depression model .
DOC.brief_title: MOMCare : Culturally Relevant Treatment Services Perinatal Depression
DOC.detailed_description: The randomize control trial evaluate effect culturally relevant , multi-component intervention antenatal depression . MOMCare potential overcome patient , provider , system-level barrier care engage depress , low-income woman evidence-based treatment reduce antenatal depressive symptom , improve maternal psychosocial functioning , ameliorate postpartum depression . Specific Aim 1 : To evaluate impact MOMCare treatment engagement retention . Specific Aim 2 : To evaluate impact MOMCare maternal clinical symptom functional outcome . Specific Aim 3 : To conduct incremental cost-effectiveness analysis health care welfare agency perspective include ) track medical cost health service use MOMCare usual care patient ; b ) monitoring use infant preventative health service group ; c ) track percentage woman Medicaid percentage work group . The intervention assess practical randomized control trial recruit 168 pregnant woman major depression and/or dysthymia Medicaid and/or receive Maternal Support Services ( MSS ) select public health center Seattle - King County ( PHSKC ) . Patients eligible consent study enrollment randomly assign either usual care ( UC ) MOMCare . Baseline four follow-up assessment ( 3 - 18 month post-baseline ) schedule study participant group . The MOMCare intervention include choice brief interpersonal psychotherapy collaborative management antidepressant medication . Treatment response monitor , treatment adjust necessary ( add treatment , increase dosage ) .
DOC.criteria: 18 old pregnant : 1232 week gestation able speak English telephone access major depressive disorder dysthymia Medicaid receiving health care King County , Washington currently psychotherapy currently receive pharmacotherapy psychiatrist high suicide risk history bipolar disorder history schizophrenia substance use dependence previous 3 month currently relationship severe interpersonal violence history repetitive selfharm behavior
